podcast_summary: The podcast episode discusses the recent primary elections in Argentina, where candidates were chosen to represent parties and coalitions in the upcoming general elections. The episode highlights the surprising success of a candidate named Mi Ley, who has gained popularity by channeling the discontent of citizens and proposing economic policies such as dollarization. The episode also mentions the strong performance of the Kirchnerist party and the economic implications of Mi Ley's success. In addition, the episode touches on the censorship of books in Florida schools, the growing popularity of anti-obesity medications, and other news stories from around the world.

- Primarias abiertas simultáneas y obligatorias en Argentina
- Mi ley (Javier Milei) tuvo un resultado excepcional en las primarias
- Comparaciones entre Mi ley y Donald Trump son injustas
- El descontento y cabreo de la población argentina
- Resultados de las primarias: Javier Milei (30.2%), Kirchnerismo (27%)
- El peso argentino se ha depreciado después de la victoria de Milei
- Impacto de la dolarización propuesta por Mi ley en la economía argentina
